item.title: Make Money Not War: Trump’s Real Plan for Peace in Ukraine
item.description: The Kremlin pitched the White House on peace through business. To Europe’s dismay, the president and his envoy are on board.
item.dc:creator: Annie Ng

item.title: Trump to Pardon Honduran Ex-President Serving 45-Year Drug Sentence
item.description: The planned pardon of Hernández, convicted of cocaine trafficking, comes before the country’s election.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: Opinion | Ukraine Corruption and U.S. Interests
item.description: Kyiv’s critics see an excuse to abandon our strategic partner.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Mystery Blasts Rock Russia-Linked Oil Tankers Off Turkey’s Coast
item.description: The two vessels belong to the so-called shadow fleet that Moscow has tapped to sidestep Western sanctions on the movement of its oil.
item.dc:creator: Elvan Kivilcim

item.title: New Peace Push Offers Clues to Fundamental Question: What Does Putin Want?
item.description: The Russian leader wants far more than just the conquest of eastern Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Zelensky’s Top Aide Resigns as Corruption Probe Deepens
item.description: The departure of Ukraine’s top negotiator—the president’s right-hand man Andriy Yermak—comes at a pivotal moment for the country.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Deadly Clash Deepens Rift Between Israel and Syria
item.description: Israel’s military says its troops entered an area in southern Syria to apprehend two suspected militants when they came under fire.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: Opinion | The Risk of F-35s in Riyadh
item.description: The proposition isn’t as dangerous as some think.

item.title: ‘There Was No Alarm’: Hong Kong Inferno Spread Across Towers in Silence
item.description: Shrouded buildings and broken alarms left many apartment dwellers unaware of the unfolding disaster.
item.dc:creator: Yang Jie

item.title: The Answer to a 1,700-Year-Old Christian Mystery Lay in a Lake in Turkey
item.description: Pope Leo XIV is visiting the ruins of a basilica that archaeologists now say hosted an important early Christian council.
item.dc:creator: Elvan Kivilcim

item.title: Vivendi Takeover by Bollore Less Likely After Court Rules in Favor of Billionaire
item.description: A French court overturned a ruling that the family of Vincent Bollore had de facto control of Vivendi, quashing investor hopes that the billionaire might be forced into a full takeover of the media group.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Kirby

item.title: Nexperia Urges China Unit to Restore Chip Flow Amid Fears of Supply Squeeze
item.description: The Chinese owner of Nexperia, Wingtech Technology, in response called on its Dutch subsidiary to enter talks over control of the company.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Kirby

item.title: Israel Investigates Shooting of Two Palestinians in West Bank Raid
item.description: Israeli authorities said they are reviewing the conduct of security forces after video footage appeared to show the men surrendering.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: The Deadly Mix of Factors That Made a Hong Kong High-Rise Fire So Devastating
item.description: A blaze in a densely packed housing complex took more than 24 hours to bring under control and was the deadliest in decades.
item.dc:creator: Jason Chau

item.title: Japan Plans Extra Bond Issuance That May Fuel Fiscal Fears
item.description: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s cabinet on Friday approved a draft supplementary budget for the fiscal year ending March 2026 that is worth 18.303 trillion yen, or about $117.10 billion.
item.dc:creator: Megumi Fujikawa

item.title: Trump Is Silent on Taiwan After Talking to Xi—and That Is Fine With Taipei
item.description: Taiwan is making the most of the U.S.’s policy of “strategic ambiguity,” even as President Trump’s stance raises concern for some.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: Europe Fears It Can’t Catch Up in Great Power Competition
item.description: Underarmed and politically fractious, the continent worries it is becoming the biggest loser in the new era of transactional politics.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: ‘Deliver or Die’: Inside the Drug-Boat Crews Ferrying Cocaine to the U.S.
item.description: The high-seas cowboys who speed tons of cocaine to American consumers are now getting blown out of the water. They say it won’t stop them.
item.dc:creator: Juan Forero

item.title: Canada’s Carney Loses Cabinet Minister Over Easing of Climate-Change Rules
item.description: The prime minister faces his first major political setback, as a cabinet member steps down following a deal cut with the energy-rich province of Alberta that would suspend certain curbs on oil-and-gas carbon emissions.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Witness Photos Captured Attack on the National Guard
item.description: Footage from a passerby at Wednesday’s shooting shows a man holding a revolver and a U.S. National Guardsman returning fire.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: Opinion | Britain Budgets for National Decline
item.description: Labour’s tax increases are pushing workers and investors abroad.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Worshiping God at the Ends of the Earth
item.description: From Tonga and Seoul to Zambia and Chile, the Gospel unites people in bonds of love.
item.dc:creator: Tim Keesee

item.title: Opinion | Is Europe Awakening at Last to Its Economic Peril?
item.description: Milder-than-expected regulations, pro-business thinking. Something may be happening in the EU.
item.dc:creator: Joseph C. Sternberg

item.title: Opinion | How Russia’s Ukraine War Crosses the Polish Border
item.description: Welcome to Rzeszów, a key hub for refugees and humanitarian support some 65 miles from Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Jillian Kay Melchior

item.title: Iranian Funds for Hezbollah Are Flowing Through Dubai
item.description: The Lebanese militia, a U.S.-designated terrorist group, needs funds to rebuild and rearm its militia after its fight with Israel last year, said people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Putin Says U.S. Plan for Ending Ukraine War a Starting Point, Needs Work
item.description: In his first public comments about the latest U.S. push for peace between Russia and Ukraine, the Russian leader described the plan as a list of questions requiring work.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Military Youth Service, a Cold War Relic, Makes a Comeback in France
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron is reviving the practice as European countries look for ways to mobilize the masses to counter Russia.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: Pope Leo Heads to Turkey and Lebanon for His First Foreign Trip
item.description: After a low-profile start to his pontificate, Pope Leo XIV is stepping into the limelight with his first foreign trip after six months in office.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: U.K. Budget Trims Inflation But Offers Limited Relief for BOE
item.description: The budget is unlikely to cool inflation in a sustained manner that would open the way for many more rate cuts, economists say.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: Wacker Chemie Becomes Latest German Company to Cut Jobs in Ailing Labor Market
item.description: The company plans to cut more than 1,500 jobs in a move to reduce costs and boost its edge against Chinese competition.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Kirby

item.title: Where Trump Sees Deals, Russia and China See a Chance to Disrupt U.S. Alliances
item.description: Moscow and Beijing have played to the president’s dealmaking, rattling America’s security partners.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Three Arrested as Hong Kong Fire Death Toll Rises to at Least 65
item.description: Authorities pointed to a failure to meet building-safety standards as a possible reason for the spread of the blaze that engulfed a high-rise complex.
item.dc:creator: Natasha Khan

item.title: Trump, After Call With China’s Xi, Told Tokyo to Lower the Volume on Taiwan
item.description: Japan, a U.S. ally that had angered China on Taiwan, found the message worrying.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Vanke’s Bid to Delay Bond Payment Sparks Selloff in Chinese Developers
item.description: China Vanke’s proposal to delay repayment on a two billion yuan onshore bond due Dec. 15 triggered selloffs in the sector.
item.dc:creator: Jiahui Huang

item.title: Germany’s Secret Plan for War With Russia
item.description: A classified blueprint shows why weapons or troop numbers alone may not decide the outcome of a broader conflict between Moscow and the West.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: The JD Vance Classmate Emerging as a Key Player in Talks to End the Ukraine War
item.description: President Trump has enlisted Army Secretary Dan Driscoll to handle high-stakes diplomacy in the administration’s push to find a peace deal.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Protected Status for Haitian Migrants to Expire in February
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security says anyone without the right to stay in the U.S. will be required to return to the island.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Hackman

item.title: Leaked U.S.-Russia Call Sets Off Global Game of Clue: Who Did It—And Why?
item.description: Diplomats and amateur sleuths are chasing questions of means and motive, including who had the capacity to eavesdrop on a call between top officials and who would benefit the most from leaking the conversation?
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Paramilitary Expansion Shows Scale of War Preparations on NATO’s Eastern Frontier
item.description: As sabotage and drone attacks mount across Europe, civilians in Lithuania are tooling up for a kinetic war.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: U.K. Unveils Sweeping New Tax Hikes
item.description: The Treasury chief said the measures, from a tax on more expensive properties to a levy on sweet dairy products such as milkshakes, would patch up public finances.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: White House Defends Witkoff After Leak of Conversation With Russian Official
item.description: U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff reportedly coached an aide to Russia’s leader on dealing with President Trump on Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: The Reason Venezuela’s Maduro Won’t Resign Peacefully
item.description: Unlike past dictators, the South American strongman has few options to enjoy an easy life in exile.
item.dc:creator: José de Córdoba

item.title: China’s Xi Calls Trump in Unusual Move to Discuss Taiwan, Ukraine
item.description: The two leaders spoke as Washington, Kyiv and Moscow try to hammer out a plan to end the Russia-Ukraine war.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: How the U.S. Drafted a Russia-Friendly Peace Plan for Ukraine
item.description: Crucial input from a Kremlin confidant influenced the document that for a week roiled relations among the U.S., Ukraine and Europe.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Ukraine Peace-Plan Negotiators Leave Thorniest Issues to Trump and Zelensky
item.description: What happens to territory coveted by the Kremlin but not seized by Moscow’s troops during the war is a major sticking point in any peace deal.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: School Kidnappings Have Become a Cruel Fact of Life in Nigeria
item.description: President Trump has threatened military intervention to head off what he says is the persecution of Christians, but children of all faiths are abducted, often for money.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: He Was Rebuilding Hezbollah—Until an Israeli Missile Found Him in Beirut
item.description: Haytham Ali Tabatabai was key to the group’s efforts to reconstitute its ranks after last year’s war with Israel.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: White House Hails Progress on Ukraine Talks, but Zelensky Is Cautious
item.description: Officials from the U.S., Ukraine and Europe held meetings in Geneva to discuss next steps on the proposal.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: ISIS Prisons and Camps Are Festering in a Fragile Syria as Aid Peters Out
item.description: U.S. military commanders warn the group is trying to free members and radicalize their families in detention.
item.dc:creator: Sudarsan Raghavan

item.title: Japan’s New Leader Infuriated Beijing. She Isn’t Backing Down.
item.description: Workaholic Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is riding high despite the perils of a fight with Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Junko Fukutome

item.title: Israel Says It Killed Top Hezbollah Commander in Beirut
item.description: The latest strike on Beirut adds more strain on an increasingly shaky cease-fire between Israel and Lebanon, as Israel continues to strike the military group on a daily basis.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: The Failed Crusade to Keep a Rare-Earths Mine Out of China’s Hands
item.description: The failure of one Western company to build a China-free rare-earths supply shows how Beijing has come to dominate the supply.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: Militants Abduct 300 Children From Catholic School in Nigeria
item.description: Students were taken from their dormitories and forced into the forest at gunpoint, police said.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Storied South African Club Embodies Decline of Former Gold Capital
item.description: Founded by white mining magnates, the Rand Club mirrors South Africa’s rise and fall as the capital of the global gold industry.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Jamie Dimon Threw King Charles a Birthday Party
item.description: The king didn’t actually attend, but celebrities and British nobility toasted the 77 year-old monarch at JPMorgan’s new headquarters
item.dc:creator: Alexander Saeedy

item.title: U.K. Government Borrowing Runs Ahead of Plan as Budget Looms
item.description: Total borrowing for the first seven months of the fiscal year now stands at £116.8 billion, £9.9 billion above projections in March.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Maasai Sue Marriott Over Ritz-Carlton Safari Camp
item.description: Tribal leaders say the tourism development blocks one of the main migration routes of the Serengeti.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: U.K. Follows Europe and U.S. in Crackdown on Asylum Seekers
item.description: Moves include threatening visa restrictions on countries that don’t take back failed asylum seekers, something President Trump has done.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Pakistan Points Finger at India Over Suicide Blast
item.description: The accusation came as India’s prime minister vowed to find the perpetrators of a separate deadly explosion on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Car Explosion in India’s Capital Kills Eight
item.description: Indian officials said it was too early to say if the blast was the result of a bomb.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: The Power of Gen Z Protesters Meets Lethal Force in Tanzania
item.description: Demonstrators have been protesting the cost of living and President Samia Suluhu Hassan’s tightening grip on power.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Will India and China Be Able to Resist U.S. Sanctions on Russian Oil?
item.description: New Delhi and Beijing have so far resisted U.S. calls to stop buying Russian crude, but far-reaching sanctions will be hard to ignore.
item.dc:creator: Jiahui Huang

item.title: Trump Signals Support for Selling Submarines to Australia
item.description: The president’s comments calmed fears that he would pull out of the Biden-era deal and came as he struck an agreement with the U.S. ally on rare earths.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: How a Right-Wing Hindu Group Went From Fringe to Mainstream in India
item.description: India’s Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh group is stepping out of the shadows and flexing its power.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Trump Organization Expands in India, Where Many of Its Partners Face Accusations
item.description: Indian real-estate firms have been accused of fraud, money laundering and more on other projects. The Trumps have stepped up overseas deals in the president’s second term.
item.dc:creator: Peter Grant

item.title: Pentagon Review of Aukus Security Pact Worries U.K., Australia
item.description: The review throws into doubt a strategic partnership that aims to give Australia nuclear-powered submarines and deter Chinese aggression in the Indo-Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Russia’s Side Quest to Dominate Africa: Hijack a Videogame
item.description: Players in the ‘African Dawn’ videogame are asked to choose a side aligned with either Russia or the West.
item.dc:creator: Sarah E. Needleman

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
